snippet: The planned factory will produce batteries for Tesla’s all-electric vehicles, as well as modules designed for the stationary storage market, according to a news release from Tesla.
abstract: Tesla reports second-quarter losses of $62 million, or 50 cents a share, down from loss of $30.5 million in year-ago quarter; report follows announcement of agreement with Panasonic to build a large-scale battery plant in the United States.
lead_paragraph: The planned factory will produce batteries for Tesla’s all-electric vehicles, as well as modules designed for the stationary storage market, according to a news release from Tesla.

headline.main: Tesla and Panasonic Agree to Build Factory in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Tesla and Panasonic Agree to Build Factory in U.S.
